snippet.title: SNES Longplay [126] Super Bomberman 5
snippet.description:
http://www.longplays.org

Played by: Tarosan

Super Bomberman 5, released by Hudson Soft in early 1997, was the final Bomberman game to grace the Super Famicom/Super Nintendo. The 
game was released in two variations: a standard cartridge and a gold cartridge, which was sold exclusively through CoroCoro Comic. The gold cartridge 
contains included extra maps in battle mode.

The story is that an evil Bomber named Emperor Terrorin with the power of Time itself, has freed various criminal Bombers from their prisons in orbit 
around Planet Bomber. Setting them up in a warped time and space, Shirobon (White Bomberman), Kurobon (Black Bomberman), and their Louie (Rui) 
companions must travel through stages and defeat them before going up against Emperor Terrorin himself.

EXTRA COMMENT: This is the quickest way to complete the game and get the good ending, otherwise it's a non-linear game that allows you to go to any 
level you want and pretty much fully complete it 100% and when beaten you can go for a 200% completion rate, the multiplayer is what this game is 
mainly well known for, one of the best Multiplayer games to never come out of Japan. -
Disclaimer: Most videos by World of Longplays use SaveStates!
